name: The Chancellor Hotel

reviews.text: Being given the Old Main Suite was a good way to start my first visit to Fayetteville.
reviews.title: Brand new hotel in lovely university town

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is a classy hotel, with all the mod-cons you could ask for and could easily think you were in New York City.
reviews.title: Great hotel. Great location. Great makeover.

reviews.text: This suite has two complete bedrooms, one with two double beds, tv and bathroom. Then the one I slept in which is a king-bed, tv and bathroom with a super-large shower stall.
reviews.title: Great Staff, Great Place

reviews.text: It would have been great if there had been multiple shower heads, but alas no. The size is slightly ridiculous as you have to walk from one side of the shower to get your shampoo off the ledge and then walk back under the water. They might want to rethink that!
reviews.title: Great Value, Outstanding Location, Great Staff.
Excellent. Will stay here again.
reviews.text: There is also a dining table with banquette and guest bathroom by the entrance to the room.

I have stayed twice at the Chancellor since its renovation. The renovation is a huge improvement and the public seems to be responding to it. The Chancellor is humming with activity and guests. It is close to Dickson St and right off the Fayetteville square which is home to various restaurants and retail shops. The restaurant is good and the bar is usually well attended. I actually really like the bar and the fact that it is accessible from lobby where you can see friends enter, etc.
reviews.title: Nice, upscale hotel but still needs some attention to detail

reviews.text: A couple of suggestions- my most recent stay was in late May on a night when terrible thunderstorms were in the area. I watched the weather for a while but finally turned the tv off and went to sleep about 10:30. (I was on the 12th floor). I woke up the next morning and noticed what I thought was my bill under the door but was actually a note that management had evidently slipped under all guests doors which warned us of a tornado warning in the area and told us to "take cover in the interior hallways immediately." Seriously? I was warned about a tornado by a note slipped under my door in the middle of the night? Whose idea was that? Is this the hotel industry norm? This needs to change. Surely an automated phone call or something similar is safer and more effective.
reviews.title: Good hotel, great location, excellent beds

reviews.text: Also, I would love it if the Chancellor had complimentary coffee somewhere in the lobby. (something the Ritz in KC does nicely) Coffee is such a great (and cheap) way to pamper guests. (coffee in the room with package creamer, etc is only good in a pinch) I was able to buy a coffee in the bar the next morning but that was not as easy or convenient as it could be.
reviews.title: Poor handling of disruptive guests

reviews.text: All in all, I will continue to stay at the Chancellor.
reviews.title: OUTSTANDING!!!!

reviews.text: Good hotel, great location, excellent beds. Probably the best real hotel in Fayetteville. Great bar, excellent restaurant. Service and front desk very good. I don't know what the beds were, but they were extremely comfortable.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.text: Beds feel strange - very soft, especially in the middle, and pillows are too thick. Large gaps at bottom and side of door creating noise problem when most people slam the doors. Thermostat emits a bright blue glow, so you need eye shades to sleep as the room is well lit. Light cannot be turned off. Thermostat set to 68F but room temp was 72F all night.
reviews.title: Uncomfortable beds, Gaps around door

reviews.text: Restaurant prices are too high for this part of the country. Parking is in a garage behind hotel. Room key is used to raise the gate and the validator where you put the card is recessed behind a larger credit card validator and easy to overlook when entering garage. I saw several people unable to locate the slot until told where it was. Also, the entrance and exit are through the same gate in the same lane.
reviews.title: Nicely Renovated Hotel

reviews.text: I stayed at The Chancellor for a Mom's weekend with my son for the University of Arkansas. This hotel is conveniently located to the campus, fraternity houses, Dickson St. and many local shops. I stayed at this hotel several years back and there is no comparison between what it was then and what it is now. The decor of the hotel is tasteful and it has a very modern feel to it. There are great views, great service. Super friendly staff. Amber, at the front desk was an absolute doll and answered all of the questions that I had without hesitation. Very friendly and professional.
reviews.title: Management did not respond

reviews.text: I will definitely stay at this hotel again when we are back in town!
reviews.title: Wonderful!

reviews.text: We rented 2 rooms. We checked in on a Fri. evening. Both rooms had same problems. The water was cold. I reported it...was told there was a problem, but it would be corrected soon. Sat. AM....still cold water....."working on it". Also, the fitness center was closed because of some electrical problem. "we will call you when it opens". No call was left when it was opened? Sewer gas smell was horrible. I complained about that. Maintenance/or housekeeping came to room and closed the drains, and shut the bathroom door. That smell was there for 2 days/2 nights. Horrible. gave me a headache. When I left, I complained to desk about service, was told GM was not there, but would call me the next day.....6 days later,still no call. Hotel's location is great.Nicely decorated. Dining area/bar nice, doorman/waiter nice. We have a large wedding coming up next year in Fayetteville. We were hoping to use this hotel.......not sure that will happen with the service and attitude of management. what a shame.
reviews.title: Clean, Modern and downtown

reviews.text: Stayed here recently for a convention. The staff was friendly and helpful, the room clean and nicely decorated. I stayed in a corner room at the end of the hall and had no issues with noise. The only reason I would not rate it excellent is due to the parking situation, had to park in garage behind hotel. This is not the hotel's fault, just simply due to the downtown location, but as a female traveling alone, it's a little unnerving. Would be a great place to spend the weekend when you could enjoy Dickson street, football game, etc.
reviews.title: Clean, modern decor, comfortable bed

reviews.text: The parking is a little bit of a hassle. Have to park across the street in a parking garage after checking in. Really enjoyed the decor of the room, and we found the beds to be very comfortable. The bar seemed to be fun - good crowd having fun on a Thursday night. Had a great sleep. Enjoyed the location - quite a few good restaurants right around the hotel. Great service - everyone was very friendly and went out of their way to help us.
reviews.title: Modern with great service

reviews.text: Great location near some cute shops in downtown Fayetteville, and close to Dickson St (a little over a mile to the edge of U of A campus, and 1.7 to the heart of campus....I measured it on gps:). Well designed, clean and modern room, only negative was the horrible pillows (really bad, I ended up sleeping w/o one), and rooms are not very sound proof, but they seem to spread people out so it was not a problem. Lounge was great place to drink a glass of wine, and breakfast was good. I got the feeling the hotel was kind of new....it seemed like all the employees wanted to give you great service but they forgot simple things, like a spoon or cream with coffee....small things that weren't a big deal. Would definately stay here if my daughter chooses to attend U of A.
reviews.title: Modern and fun

reviews.text: Finished an 850 mile trip in to Fayetteville by arriving at the Chancellor, ready for a good rest. Bellhop stacked luggage on cart, and my laptop bag slid off and ejected my laptop onto the sidewalk. Poor guy looked adequately mortified..... I checked my scratched up computer and luckily it booted right up.
reviews.title: Noisy room, uncomfortable beds.
Urban Chic in Downtown Fayetteville
reviews.text: Checked in, got room 911. Lobby looks nice, very modern looking with an Asian feel. Went up and started to get settled. Room was nice looking and clean.

description: The Chancellor Hotel is the newest hotel in Northwest Arkansas! Featuring 205 brand new, luxurious guest rooms and suites, a stunning lobby bar and restaurant and exceptional meeting facilities, The Chancellor is the best choice for leisure or business travel. All rooms feature stunning contemporary decor, flat screen HDTV's, a full high definition channel line-up, HBO and Showtime, luxury bed linens and bath amenities, pillow top mattresses and complimentary high speed Internet access. Conveniently located to all destinations in Northwest Arkansas, The Chancellor Hotel is situated on the beautiful town square in Fayetteville, convenient to shopping and dining. A state-of-the-art Fitness Center featuring LifeFitness equipment, fully equipped complimentary Business Center providing PC's and iMac's and an indoor/outdoor swimming pool add to your enjoyment.
